the_shadow_6_principle.first_pass: Shadow - acknowledged but not dwelt upon. The imperfect-6 that would slow amplification-to-completion arc
the_shadow_6_principle.second_pass: Mother - nurturing, generative force. Perfect imperfection that births growth
the_shadow_6_principle.key_insight: Same position, different relationship. Transform through understanding rather than bypass through avoidance.

part_1_foundation.title: 5â†’7 Foundation - The Amplification-to-Completion Principle
part_1_foundation.purpose: Establish why this transition matters and how it operates
key_questions: Why does amplification (5) lead directly to completion (7)?
What role does the shadow-6 play in this journey?
How do multiplication and sacred wholeness relate?
What makes this transition different from other prime leaps?
part_1_foundation.tone: Foundational, clear, accessible - sets stage for deeper work

part_2_prime_05.title: PRIME_05 Deep Dive - Quintessence and Amplification Mechanics
part_2_prime_05.purpose: Expand existing PRIME_05 content into comprehensive framework

core_concepts.quintessence: The fifth element that amplifies all others (beyond earth, water, fire, air)
core_concepts.amplification_vs_addition: 5 doesn't just add, it multiplies. Changes the nature, not just the quantity
core_concepts.fifth_position_power: Why 5th appears across systems (senses, elements, platonic solids, etc)
core_concepts.practical_applications: How amplification thinking solves real problems

development_areas: Mechanics of amplification (how it actually works)
What gets amplified vs what gets bypassed
The role of 5 in pattern recognition

part_3_shadow_6_bridge.title: The Shadow-6 & Creative Bridge Space

key_concepts.shadow_6_first_pass: Human imperfection, incomplete perfection, the thing that would slow sacred completion
key_concepts.why_we_leap: 5â†’7 demonstrates direct amplification-to-completion without dwelling in imperfection

key_concepts.mother_6_second_pass: When we return with understanding, 6 becomes generative force

content_elements: How the gap functions as creative space
Transformation principle: same position, different relationship
part_3_shadow_6_bridge.special_note: This is acknowledgment, not avoidance. We see it, honor it, and continue forward.

2_to_3_transition.title: PRIME 2â†’3: Emergence to Stability
